title: Halldor Laxness - Nobel Prize in Literature, 1955 (7 books)
description:
HALLDÃƒâ€œR LAXNESS (1902-1998) was the undisputed master of contemporary Icelandic fiction and one of the outstanding novelists of the century.  Major influences on his writings included August Strindberg, Sigmund Freud, Sinclair Lewis, Upton Sinclair, Bertolt Brecht and Ernest Hemingway.  In 1955 he was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature "for his vivid epic power which has renewed the great narrative art of Iceland."


The following books are in ePUB format:

* THE FISH CAN SING (Vintage, 2008).  Translated by Magnus Magnusson, with an Introduction by Jane Smiley.

* THE GREAT WEAVER FROM KASHMIR (Archipelago Books, 2008). Translated by Philip Roughton.

* ICELAND'S BELL (Vintage, 2003). Translated by Philip Roughton with an Introduction by Adam Haslett.

* INDEPENDENT PEOPLE: An Epic (Vintage, 1997). Translated by J. A. Thompson with an Introduction by Brad Leithauser.

* PARADISE RECLAIMED (Vintage, 2002).  Translated by Magnus Magnusson, with an Introduction by Jane Smiley.

* UNDER THE GLACIER (Vintage, 2005).  Translated by Magnus Magnusson, with an Introduction by Susan Sontag.

* WORLD LIGHT (Vintage, 2002).  Translated by Magnus Magnusson, with an Introduction by Svens Birkerts.
